intro: Acosta divergens, commonly known as the divergent acosta, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Acosta divergens is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
